results.title: Friendship's Death
results.brief_description: In September 1970, a British war correspondent is distracted from his coverage of the conflict between Palestinians and Jordanians when he rescues a young lady from a PLO patrol. Named Friendship, she claims to be an extra terrestrial robot sent to Earth on a peace mission and accidentally diverted from her original destination, The Massachusetts Institute of Technology. Is she insane, a spy, or telling the truth? Wollen’s film comes across as a two-set Dr Who for adults, complete with political, philosophical and personal problems. Rated: M

results.title: Friends of the family
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Derek Lamb, David Verrall and Yossi Abolafia
results.brief_description: An animated children’s film that illustrates the different projects that UNICEF uses its funds for. Two young children suddenly find that their own comfortable home surroundings have disappeared and that they are in a very poor village that does not even have a water pump. UNICEF comes to the rescue! Suitable for middle and upper primary levels.

results.title: Friends and other people
results.creator_credit: Centre for Study of Higher Education
results.brief_description: A teaching model used to educate the intellectually disabled about types of relationships, clarifying social norms and behavioural expectations,in order to deal with loneliness, low self esteem and vulnerability to exploitation. Includes a booklet by Susie Smith and Judi Gray.

results.title: Friends and neighbors = Friends and neighbours
results.creator_credit: Sterling Educational Films, Lori Productions, Jack Wipper and Edmund Penney
results.brief_description: Investigates learning to live together, how to treat friends and neighbours, and shows how it is often easy to take advantage of the weak and gullible and to ignore social responsibility. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Friends and foes
results.creator_credit: ABC-TV (Australia), Victorian College of Agriculture and Horticulture and Martin Green
results.brief_description:
Episode number 6 of Series “Growing awareness: Factors in plant production”.
There are major biotic factors which affect plant growth including the impact of pests and diseases and the competition with other plants for light and resources. Highlighted are some of the techniques developed to control these problems and the beneficial relationships which exist between plants and living organisms. A contemporary approach known as Integrated Pest Management looks at various methods used to control pests and disease while minimising environmental impact.

results.title: Friends and Enemies
results.brief_description: This is a provocative film about one of the most vicious and protracted labour disputes in Australian history. In February 1985, over one thousand electrical workers went on strike against the introduction of contractors into the South East Queensland Electricity Board. Rated: PG

results.title: Friends
results.creator_credit: Churchill Films and Peter Van Deusen
results.brief_description: Looks at the concept of friendship. The story involves three girls - one, a possessive girl, another with an extroverted nature and the third who is seen by the first girl to threaten the friendship. The film is open-ended and relates to the social studies theme of “cultural influences”. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Friendly Fiji
results.brief_description: Fiji, one time home of warring tribes, is now a peace loving island with a thriving tourist trade. Palm beaches, ocean waters, traditional native ceremonies, and the cosmopolitan capital of Suva are among the many attractions. Outlines Fiji’s history from the first missionaries, to British Dependency in 1874, and the present government. Shows the ceremonial opening of the Legislative Council, soldiers in parade dres, and the official raising of the flag.
